info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 05 at 5:57PM EDT until August 05 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR NORTHEASTERN ALLEGHENY COUNTY... At 557 PM EDT, local law enforcement reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain in Sharpsburg, Aspinwall and Ohara Township. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 1 to 2 inches in 1 hour. Flash flooding is already occurring. Numerous roads have been closed in the area. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Pittsburgh, Penn Hills, Ross Township, McCandless Township, Shaler Township, Plum, Hampton Township, Wilkinsburg, O`hara Township, Bellevue, West View, Stowe Township, Oakmont, McKees Rocks, Fox Chapel, Millvale, Etna, Sharpsburg, Churchill and Aspinwall. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-2 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
